intro: Chimarrhis cymosa subsp. microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its smaller, more compact fruit compared to other members of the species. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland areas. This plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
